'''Darby Conley''' is an [[United States|American]] [[cartoonist]] best known for the newspaper [[comic strip]] ''[[Get Fuzzy]]''.
==Biography== Conley was born in Concord, Massachusetts in 1970, and grew up in Knoxville, Tennessee.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/53523.Darby_Conley |title=Darby Conley |website=Good Reads}}</ref>
While in high school in 1986, he won a student cartooning competition. During his Senior Year at Doyle High School (now South-Doyle High School) in Knoxville, Conley was voted 'Most Talented' by his graduating class. Conley was a member of [[Amherst College]]'s [[a cappella|a-cappella]] group, the Zumbyes.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thezumbyes.com/alumni/ |title=Alumni |website=The Zumbyes |accessdate=2 October 2016}}</ref>
==''Get Fuzzy''== Comics syndicate [[United Media]] agreed in 1999 to publish Conley's new strip ''[[Get Fuzzy]]'' about an anthropomorphic cat, Bucky, and dog, Satchel, living with their single young-male owner, Rob Wilco, which premiered on September 6, 1999.<ref>Price, Robert (July 29, 2016), "[http://www.bakersfield.com/columnists/sound-off-history-is-achieved-but-no-photo-to-document/article_92490de0-12e5-50a8-a0a5-79f6ff6bae78.html Sound Off: History is achieved, but no photo to document it?]," Bakersfield. Retrieved September 20, 2016</ref> The idea for Bucky's character came from a friend's [[Siamese (cat)|Siamese]].<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.popcultmag.com/obsessions/profilesingreatness/fuzzy/fuzzy1.html | title = Let's Get Fuzzy | first = Coury | last = Turczyn | year = 2002 | publisher = PopCult Magazine | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20050418041639/http://popcultmag.com/obsessions/profilesingreatness/fuzzy/fuzzy1.html | archivedate = 2005-04-18 | df = }}</ref> Daily strips of Get Fuzzy ended in 2013 and were replaced by reruns; as of 2017 the Sunday strips are also in reruns.<ref>Ward, Alyson (April 7, 2017), "[http://www.chron.com/entertainment/article/What-happened-to-the-Get-Fuzzy-comic-strip-11057644.php What happened to the 'Get Fuzzy' comic strip?]," Houston. Retrieved August 20, 2017</ref>
===Awards=== *2002, [[National Cartoonists Society]] Award for Newspaper Comic Strip.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.reuben.org/ncs-awards/division-awards/#strip | title = Division Awards: Newspaper Strip | publisher = [[National Cartoonists Society]] | accessdate = April 19, 2013}}</ref>
==Controversies== On October 30, 2003, the city of [[Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania|Pittsburgh]] served as the [[punch line]] of a strip about [[tourism]] destinations based on smells. Offended residents of the area deluged the author with negative feedback that included death threats.<ref>{{citation | url = http://www.post-gazette.com/stories/business/news/comic-strip-apology-to-really-isnt-521800/ | title = Comic strip apology to really isn't: 'Get Fuzzy' creator says Pittsburghers need to take a joke | date = November 18, 2003 | first= Dan |last = Fitzpatrick | newspaper = Pittsburgh Post-Gazette}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kcra.com/travelgetaways/2613194/detail.html |title=Pittsburgh Not Laughing At Smelly Joke - Travel News Story |publisher=KCRA Sacramento |date=2003-11-05 |accessdate=2010-05-13 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081204090709/http://www.kcra.com/travelgetaways/2613194/detail.html |archivedate=December 4, 2008 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.post-gazette.com/stories/business/news/letters-to-the-business-editor-111103-521354/ | title = Letters to the Business Editor: 11/11/03 | date = November 11, 2003 | publisher = ''Pittsburgh Post-Gazette''}}</ref>
A May 13, 2005 strip portrayed Boston-area sports reporter [[Bob Lobel]] as a drunk, prompting Lobel to file [[libel]] lawsuits against Conley and his syndicate.<ref name=head>{{cite web |url=http://www.bostonmagazine.com/articles/head_games_1/ |title=Head Games |publisher=Boston Magazine |date=July 2005 |first=Gretchen |last=Voss |accessdate=2010-05-13 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100820194619/http://www.bostonmagazine.com/articles/head_games_1/ |archivedate=2010-08-20 |df= }}</ref><ref name=btp>{{cite web|url=http://www.greaterboston.tv/features/btp_20050520_fuzzy.html |title=Lobel Charges Libel |date=May 20, 2005 |publisher=WGBH |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060924181404/http://www.greaterboston.tv/features/btp_20050520_fuzzy.html |archivedate=September 24, 2006 }}</ref>
